learning_outcomes: Use 'much' with uncountable nouns in negative and interrogative sentences
Apply 'a lot of' correctly in affirmative sentences

content.prompt_es: ¿Cuál usas para preguntar por la cantidad de dinero?

content.stimulus_en: I don't have ________ time, but I have ________ books.

content.prompt_es: Une el cuantificador con el tipo de nombre:

blocks.title: A lot of / A few / A little

content.prompt_es: ¿Cuál usas para decir que tienes 'un poco' de agua?

content.stimulus_es: We have a lot of food.
content.correct_answer: We have a lot of food

content.text: A few cookies, a little milk, and a lot of sugar.

content.prompt_es: Si no tienes mucho dinero, dices:

content.stimulus_es: How much time do we have?
content.correct_answer: How much time do we have

content.stimulus_en: How ________ people are there? There aren't ________, only ________.

content.prompt_es: Escribe 'Tengo mucha agua' usando 'a lot of':
content.stimulus_es: I have a lot of water.
content.correct_answer: I have a lot of water

content.prompt_es: Escucha y escribe lo que oyes:
content.stimulus_en: How much money do you have?
content.correct_answer: How much money do you have?

content.prompt_es: Escucha y escribe lo que oyes:
Escucha y escribe lo que oyes:
content.stimulus_en: I have a lot of friends.
content.correct_answer: I have a lot of friends.
